comments:
Build 3.2 M3
Linux-GTK

I'm currently suspended at a breakpoint and every time I click on a variable,
I'm getting exceptions written to the log. I think what's happening is that I'm
using an old launch config (it's a remote Java attach) whose source lookup
includes JARs that no longer exist.

Writing these exceptions to the log all the time seems kind of ugly. This
message ("Your source lookup path is bogus"), it really intended for the user.
Would it make sense to pop up a dialog instead of logging this error? Maybe
something like...
  Title: Source Lookup Error
  Message: The following Source Lookup Entries were not found:
               <entry1>
               <entry2>
               <etc.>
            Edit the Source Lookup Path now?
                      Yes (open LCD on the Source tab of the config) | No

The following exception is logged for each invalid entry:

java.util.zip.ZipException: No such file or directory
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:204)
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.sourcelookup.SourceLookupUtils.getZipFile(SourceLookupUtils.java:67)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.containers.ExternalArchiveSourceContainer.getArchive(ExternalArchiveSourceContainer.java:193)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.containers.ExternalArchiveSourceContainer.findSourceElements(ExternalArchiveSourceContainer.java:79)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.AbstractSourceLookupParticipant.findSourceElements(AbstractSourceLookupParticipant.java:67)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.AbstractSourceLookupDirector$SourceLookupQuery.run(AbstractSourceLookupDirector.java:126)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:1044)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:783)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.AbstractSourceLookupDirector.doSourceLookup(AbstractSourceLookupDirector.java:461)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.AbstractSourceLookupDirector.getSourceElement(AbstractSourceLookupDirector.java:711)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.getJavaProject(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:189)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.getCompiledExpression(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:317)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.resolveFormatter(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:158)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.access$1(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:151)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager$4.run(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:139)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread$ThreadJob.run(JDIThread.java:2448)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

--------------------------------------------------------------------
The following exception is also logged every time, but I think this just looks
like exception wrapping code:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Source lookup error
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.AbstractSourceLookupParticipant.findSourceElements(AbstractSourceLookupParticipant.java:95)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.AbstractSourceLookupDirector$SourceLookupQuery.run(AbstractSourceLookupDirector.java:126)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:1044)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:783)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.AbstractSourceLookupDirector.doSourceLookup(AbstractSourceLookupDirector.java:461)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.core.sourcelookup.AbstractSourceLookupDirector.getSourceElement(AbstractSourceLookupDirector.java:711)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.getJavaProject(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:189)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.getCompiledExpression(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:317)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.resolveFormatter(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:158)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.access$1(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:151)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager$4.run(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:139)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread$ThreadJob.run(JDIThread.java:2448)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Fixed in AbstractSourceLookupDirector - the platform logs any exceptions thrown by safe runnables. Changed our SourceLookupQuery to cache its exception rather than throw it. Clients of the query can user the exception as desired.

Changed JavaDetailFormattersManager to not log exception as well (was happenning in 3 places). Instead, the exception is returned as the result of the detail formatter, so the user sees it.

Not planning on the delux prompt to edit source lookup path. It's not clear that all clients will want that function, so it might need new API so a client can ask for/use that feature.
